p.Rosen College has capitalized on its loc: Rosen College has capitalized on its location, Orlando, the home to eight major theme parks and four themed water parks, and developed the world's only program dedicated to theme park and attraction management. The certificate program in Theme Park and Attraction is a specialized track of study for those interested in careers in the theme park and attraction industry. Students across UCF can take advantage of this certificate in order to gain a competitive edge to excel in careers in this expanding industry.
p.This 15-credit option can be added to a: This 15-credit option can be added to a current non-hospitality management degree. No internships are required, but it is suggested that students gain work experience in the industry in addition to the certificate. This option is especially beneficial for those students who pursue non-management aspects of themed entertainment, design, or engineering.

li.No course grade lower than a C will be a: No course grade lower than a C will be accepted for the certificate requirements.
li.The average GPA for the five courses mus: The average GPA for the five courses must be 3.00 and higher.
li.At least 12 credit hours used toward the: At least 12 credit hours used toward the certificate must be earned at UCF.

courseSection1.text:
This 15-credit option can be added to a current non-hospitality management degree. No internships are required, but it is suggested that students gain work experience in the industry in addition to the certificate. Certificate Admission Requirements
None
Certificate Requirements
No course grade lower than a C will be accepted for the certificate requirements.
The average GPA for the five courses must be 3.00 and higher.
At least 12 credit hours used toward the certificate must be earned at UCF.

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
HFT1000 - Introduction to the Hospitality and Tourism Industry (3)
HFT4755 - Theme Park and Attraction Management (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Complete at least 3 of the following: 
HFT4751 - Managing the Employee Experience in the Theme Park and Attraction Industry (3)
HFT4752 - Managing the Guest Experience in the Theme Park and Attraction Industry (3)
HFT4758 - Operational Issues in the Theme Park and Attraction Industry (3)
HFT4759 - Product Development in Theme Parks and Attractions (3)

li.The Undergraduate Certificate in Theme P: The Undergraduate Certificate in Theme Park and Attraction Management is available to any UCF student pursuing any degree at UCF, except for the Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship or Independent Study credit m: Internship or Independent Study credit may not be used toward the program.

Eligibility
The Undergraduate Certificate in Theme Park and Attraction Management is available to any UCF student pursuing any degree at UCF, except for the Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management.
Foreign Language Requirements
None
